article.headline: Rider 101, Harvard 95 (OT)
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Jerry Johnson scored 27 points and Robert Taylor added 22 Monday night as Rider extended Harvard's losing streak to 12 straight games over the past two seasons with a 101-95 overtime victory. The Crimson (0-10) have dropped nine straight home games and have won just two of their last 22 games. Kevin Rogus paced Harvard with 26 points while Matt Stehle contributed 22 points and a game-high 11 rebounds. But the Crimson turned the ball over 25 times, leading to 30 Rider points. The victory was the first on the road for the Broncs (6-3) and their first in overtime in their last seven tries. Rider led by as many as 11 points 64-53 with 12:56 left in the game before Harvard went on a 23-9 run over the next 7:15 to take a 76-73 lead on Stehle's two free throws with 5:20 on the clock. But Rider answered, holding the Crimson to three field goals in the game's final 4:46. Taylor, who scored 11 points in the second half, sent the game into overtime on a layup with 13 seconds left. The Broncs then made all eight of their shots from the field in overtime. Johnson had five of those points including a 3-pointer with 32.3 left to seal the win. It was the first time Harvard has allowed an opponent to score 100 or more points in 10 years.
